Articles.Content:
This has potential, however I can't help but think that it would be impossible to cram two people side by side into a pod that is 1.25m wide. In fact, it would be difficult to cram one person into something so narrow, and even with their smaller frames kerbals would be way too big for that methinks.

And the FASA mod is kind of overkill.

I agree, but there are some absolute gems in there as well.

The Gemini and Mercury Capsules, the Big G... great IVA's aussi.

Edited December 9, 2013 by little square dot
is the download link broken? I can't download it

is the download link broken? I can't download it

It seems to be working on my end. Is anyone else having trouble downloading? I'm thinking of finding a better/alternate site to host it from, if anyone knows a good ones I'd be happy to hear.

@little square dot

You are right 1.25 is too small for two kerbals side by side, but that's why my pod is slightly wider than that and yet still meant to fit on those parts.

http://i1276.photobucket.com/albums/y477/morrowindorion/2013-12-08_00003_zps4005a635.jpg' alt='2013-12-08_00003_zps4005a635.jpg'>

It's cramped and needs a lot more love, but they do fit.
I'm not having the issue, but you could provide an alternative download link, like Spaceport, Mega or Dropbox.

It's cramped and needs a lot more love, but they do fit.

Isn't it possible to remove the centre console to create more room?
Ooooh! Me likey! Really looking forward to a 1.25m Hitchhiker pod, been wanting one for an age!

Isn't it possible to remove the centre console to create more room?

If you put two kerbals two close to each other, they clip into each others portrait, which looks really weird. So the gain in space from removing the console might not be that useful.

you're planning on making it more "Round" I hope(as its stockalike). But this is awsome in any case.

I would also kinda try and adjust the size, so like rather than be 1.25 in diameter, (or close to 1.25), rather like 2.00 in diameter, with liek an adapter to make it 2.50 or something.

Here is MFD panels from RasterPropMonitor, I didn't won't to rearrange many panels in IVA. I kept them close to the way the Orionkermin had them. I did had to move two panels around to get Rasters MFD to be somewhat centered.

You do need to be using Module Manager 1.5, most of us have it already from other mods:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219-Module-Manager-1-5-(Nov-11)

Here is link to the MM file to get the MFD panels on this Pod:

http://www./view/oot52afeycy35y7/Radish%20MFD.cfg

If you have your own custom MM file, I will put code on bottom of page for you guys to copy and paste it to you cfg file.

Here are some pictures showing the panels:


@PART[Radish*]:Final 
{
	MODULE 
	{
	name = JSIInternalPersistence
	}
}

@INTERNAL[Radish]:Final
{
	MODULE 
	{
	name = InternalCameraTargetHelper
	}		

		PROP
		{
		name = RasterPropMonitorExampleMFD
		position = 0.286245,0.1665301,-0.04349796
		rotation = -0.2440571,0,0,0.969761
		scale = 0.4408568,0.4408568,0.4408568
		}

		PROP
		{
		name = RasterPropMonitorExampleMFD
		position = -0.2876947,0.162236,-0.04119042
		rotation = -0.2440571,0,0,0.969761
		scale = 0.4408568,0.4408568,0.4408569
		}	
}

@INTERNAL[Radish]:Final
{
	@PROP[IndicatorPanel]
	{
		@name = IndicatorPanel
		@position = 0.1488323,0.1847652,-0.05670241
		@rotation = 0.503069,0,0,0.8642463
		@scale = 1,1,1
	}

	@PROP[IndicatorPanel]
	{
		@position = -0.1478301,0.1839655,-0.05624828
		@rotation = 0.503069,0,0,0.8642463
		@scale = 1,1,1
	}

	@PROP[switch]
	{
		@position = 0.2032788,0.1008166,-0.02429834
		@rotation = 0.5170107,0,0,0.8559789
		@scale = 1,1,1
	}

	@PROP[switch]
	{
		@position = -0.2037006,0.1014169,-0.024614
		@rotation = 0.5170107,0,0,0.8559789
		@scale = 1,1,1
	}

}

Enjoy!

Thanks to Mihara for giving me the knowledge to do this.

RasterPropMonitor on this capsule... Awesome.

I Using this capsule to gather some science for my career mission.
Wow. That pod is just screaming 'Murica.
Nice! I've been looking for a stock-alike 2 man pod for ages.

I just did RasterPropMonitor for stock lander cans:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/57603-0-22-RasterPropMonitor-make-your-IVA-a-glass-cockpit-%28v0-9%29?p=829785#post829785

RasterPropMonitor on this capsule... Awesome.

I Using this capsule to gather some science for my career mission.

Honestly, I wasn't a big fan of the textures. So I tried making my own.

Anyone like it? It still has some work to do. Also it needs a normal map, but I have no idea how to make one.

Honestly, I wasn't a big fan of the textures. So I tried making my own.

-snip-

Anyone like it? It still has some work to do. Also it needs a normal map, but I have no idea how to make one.

It looks great for stock-style textures! Yeah it does need a normal map. I am not good at making my own normal maps I usually just use CrazyBump for normal maps and other maps.

It looks great for stock-style textures! Yeah it does need a normal map. I am not good at making my own normal maps I usually just use CrazyBump for normal maps and other maps.

I learned how to make them in photoshop just as you posted this! So now it has a normal map. It still needs quite a lot of work though.

edit-

So bumpy!

It's pretty much done now so if OrionKerman allows it then I can release it. Anyway I have a sudden craving to texture more things! I wonder if anyone needs help...

Edited December 11, 2013 by mushroomman

It's pretty much done now so if OrionKerman allows it then I can release it. Anyway I have a sudden craving to texture more things! I wonder if anyone needs help...

I don't mind if you release it. Just don't release outside this forum please.

I've been working on the exterior of the pod quite a bit myself. I removed the hatch on the back, as I was never really happy with it. So now it's up front and eventually I'll add a model for it in the IVA. I also rounded out the bottom of the model more.

http://i1276.photobucket.com/albums/y477/morrowindorion/2013-12-10_00001_zps92d3c35a.jpg' alt='2013-12-10_00001_zps92d3c35a.jpg'>

I'm working hard with the little spare time I get right now. I'm hoping to release an update after .23 comes out and I verify that the part still works. Well back at it!
FYI you can have two hatches but they will only come out of one of them. You can go in both though.
Excellent. Can't wait to play with it. It looks much more stockalike.

Wow, that looks really good. Can't wait for the new exterior.

When you do the new IVA and need help do the props for the interior, I can volunteer to do them for you. Just PM me anything for help.

I don't mind if you release it. Just don't release outside this forum please.

I've been working on the exterior of the pod quite a bit myself. I removed the hatch on the back, as I was never really happy with it. So now it's up front and eventually I'll add a model for it in the IVA. I also rounded out the bottom of the model more.
Love the pod and the cramped interior. I do think that each Kerbalnaut should have a door, can not imagine getting over the central console in such a tight space.

Looks great! Finally somebody gets up to the challenge of doing a stock-alike 2 man pod. U da bawz, brah.

I think you should tilt the windows a bit more so we can get a better IVA view of our surroundings. Like this:

Then we might be able to take pictures like these and post them on this thread.
This is quite fantastic! Great work for a first mod

If we want a Gemini capsule then FASA has us covered, this pod should NOT evolve into that, some of us just want a stockalike 2-man pod. and the 1-man pod doesn't exactly have the greatest view now does it......

and the 1-man pod doesn't exactly have the greatest view now does it......

that is a poor argument/

1/10 almost made me upset.

.. but seriously, I wouldn't mind being able to actually see whats in front of me from IVA view.
